error.signature: Error: environment variable DATABASE_URL is not set

verdict.summary: A required environment variable is not set in the CI environment. Common causes include missing secrets configuration, incorrect variable scoping (job vs step vs workflow level), or environment-specific variables not configured for the deployment target.

dead_ends.action: Hardcoding the value directly in the workflow YAML
dead_ends.why_fails: Sensitive values (API keys, passwords, tokens) should never be committed to version control. Even for non-sensitive values, hardcoding reduces portability across environments.

dead_ends.action: Setting the variable in one job expecting it to be available in another
dead_ends.why_fails: Each GitHub Actions job runs in a fresh VM. Environment variables set in one job are not available in other jobs unless explicitly passed via outputs or artifacts.

workarounds.action: Configure the variable as a repository secret and reference it in the workflow
workarounds.how: Go to repo Settings > Secrets and variables > Actions > New repository secret. In the workflow, reference it: env: DATABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}. For environment-specific values, use GitHub Environments.

workarounds.action: Use GitHub Actions environment variables for non-sensitive values
workarounds.how: Set variables at the appropriate scope. Workflow level: env: at the top of the YAML. Job level: jobs.<id>.env. Step level: steps[*].env. For dynamic values, use echo 'VAR=value' >> $GITHUB_ENV.

leads_to.condition: when the missing variable should have been a secret
when missing SSH credentials variables cause Ansible connectivity failures

preceded_by.condition: when a secret is not found and the empty value propagates as an unset variable

frequently_confused_with.distinction: env-variable-not-set covers all environment variables; gha-secret-not-found specifically involves GitHub encrypted secrets not being accessible to the workflow
